de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions
Class Value

All Implemented Interfaces:
PrettyPrintPriorities, PrettyPrintable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Constant, Identifier, Lambda, Location, MultiLambda
public abstract class Value
extends Expression

Abstract base class for expression classes, whose instances are always values, for example Lambda expressions.

$Rev: 277 $

Method Summary
 boolean isValue()
          Returns true if the expression should be considered a value in the big and small step interpreters and must thereby not be evaluated any further. The implementation in the Value always returns true and cannot be overwritten by derived classes.

Method Detail

isValue

public final boolean isValue()
Returns true if the expression should be considered a value in the big and small step interpreters and must thereby not be evaluated any further. The default implementation in the Expression class simply returns false, so derived classes will need to override this method if their instances should be considered values under certain circumstances. The implementation in the Value always returns true and cannot be overwritten by derived classes.

Overrides:
isValue in class Expression
Returns:
true if the expression is a value, false otherwise.
See Also:
Expression.isValue()
